name: wanna
examples: I/she wanna eat out tonight
He doesn't wanna listen to my offers
What you wanna do now?

name: gonna
examples: I'm gonna ask her out to the restaurant
He's not gonna lie to his friends again
What you gonna do with the birthday party?

name: gotta
examples: I gonna call the police
He('s) gotta find out the truth
What you gonna do with the birthday party?

name: present perfect (review)
examples: She has used her car insurance once.
I have never broken the traffic rules
We have been to Lviv several times
rules: Yes, I/we/they have V3(ed) times (once, twice, several times, many times)
No, I/we/they have never V3(ed) times.

name: past perfect (review)
examples: Did you realise she had lied to you?
Did he find out they hadn't accomplished the project?
rules: Did you/he/she/they realize/know/find out/believe we/she/he/I had/hadn't V3(ed)?
Yes, I/he/she/they realized/know/found out/believed we/she/he/you had/hadn't V3(ed)
No, I/he/she/they didn't realize/know/find out/believe we/she/he/you had/hadn't V3(ed)

name: who, which, that
examples: We looked for the information. The info was on the Internet.
We looked for the info that was on the Internet.
I don't respect parents who shout at their children.
I met a travel agent at the airport who helped me.
She can't imagine any circumstances which will influence him.
He couldn't find any facts which would prove his words
She really needs someone that will handle her problem.
I will come to her wedding that will be in April
